bug.creator: Karel Srot
bug.cc: ['Elio Maldonado Batiz', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Rob Crittenden', 'Bob Relyea']
bug.cf_release_notes: libcurl HTTPS connections failed with a CURLE_OUT_OF_MEMORY error when given a certificate file name without a "/". This is now fixed to treat such a string as certificate nickname and if a file with the same name exists and libcurl runs in verbose mode, a warning is issued. The updated documentation now suggests to use the "./" prefix to load a file from the current directory.
bug.summary: curl returns CURLE_OUT_OF_MEMORY when client certificate is given

bug.creator: Ludek Finstrle
bug.summary: Unable to use proxy with kerberos authentization for https

bug.creator: Kamil Dudka
bug.cc: ['Ludek Finstrle', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Paul Howarth']
bug.cf_release_notes: libcurl was unable to authenticate http proxies via Kerberos. This is now fixed and libcurl can successfully authenticate http proxies via Kerberos.
bug.summary: Unable to use proxy with kerberos authentication for https

bug.creator: FTBFS
bug.summary: FTBFS curl-7.21.0-4.fc14

bug.creator: Michal Jaegermann
bug.summary: curl update breaks yum

bug.cc: ['Adam Williamson', 'Daniel Stenberg', 'David Cantrell', 'James Laska', 'Jared Smith', 'Kamil Dudka', 'Bill Nottingham', 'Paul Howarth']
bug.summary: some FTP servers hang if curl closes the data connection too early

bug.creator: Simon
bug.cc: ['Jeffrey C. Ollie', 'Jon Masters', 'Jeroen van Meeuwen', 'Kamil Dudka', u'Karel Kl\xed\u010d', 'Paul Howarth']
bug.summary: Fedora 14 anaconda fails to retrieve filelists.xml.gz from FTP installation repository.

bug.creator: Simon
bug.summary: Curl does not handle FTP server timeout gracefully

bug.creator: Kamil Dudka
bug.cf_release_notes: libcurl FTP protocol implementation was unable to handle server session timeouts correctly. This is now fixed so that libcurl drops the connection when a 421 timeout response is received.
bug.summary: Curl does not handle FTP server timeout gracefully

bug.creator: Miroslav Vadkerti
bug.summary: Tests 253 and 255 FAIL: stack smashing detected

bug.creator: Miroslav Vadkerti
bug.summary: Test 62 fails from upstream test suite

bug.creator: Julio Entrena Perez
bug.cc: [u'Dalibor Posp\xed\u0161il', 'Jan Vcelak', u'Ondrej Mori\u0161', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'devzero2000', 'Pierre Carrier']
bug.cf_release_notes: Previously, an attempt to send an LDAP request through an HTTP proxy tunnel ended up with cURL trying to connect to the LDAP server directly using a wrong port number. With this update, the underlying source code has been modified to address this issue, and cURL now works as expected.
bug.summary: proxy tunnel support for LDAP requests is broken

bug.creator: Kamil Dudka
bug.cc: ['Julio Entrena Perez', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier']
bug.cf_release_notes: libcurl failed when an LDAP request was sent using curl through a HTTP proxy in tunnel mode (curl option "-p" or "--proxytunnel"). Curl tried to connect directly to the LDAP server via the proxy port and consequently failed. This is now fixed to allow libcurl LDAP connections through HTTP proxies to work as expected.
bug.summary: proxy tunnel support for LDAP requests is broken

bug.creator: Martin Poole
bug.cc: [u'Ale\u0161 Mare\u010dek', 'Brian Gollaher', u'Dalibor Posp\xed\u0161il', 'Julio Entrena Perez', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier', 'Robert Binkhorst', 'J.H.M. Dassen (Ray)', 'Radek Vokal']
bug.summary: [RFE] backport of --proxy-negotiate code to allow use of kerberos auth proxy

bug.creator: Miroslav Vadkerti
bug.cf_release_notes: A rebuild operation for curl failed if the libnih-devel package was installed. This is now fixed to allow a rebuild whether libnih-devel is installed, not installed or has a broken installation.
bug.summary: Cannot rebuild curl if libnih-devel installed

bug.creator: J.H.M. Dassen (Ray)
bug.cc: ['Eduard Benes', 'Karel Srot', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier', 'Robert Binkhorst', 'Rob Crittenden']
bug.cf_release_notes: libcurl ignored the CA path provided in CURLOPT_CAPATH and consequently curl ignored the "--capath" argument provided. This is fixed so that libcurl now uses the value provided with the the "--capath" argument.
bug.summary: Curl does not honour -capath

bug.creator: DCS
bug.summary: Curl fails on redirect with explicit Host Header.

bug.creator: RHEL Product and Program Management
bug.cc: ['Julio Entrena Perez', 'Kamil Dudka', u'Ondrej Mori\u0161', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'devzero2000', 'pm-eus', 'Pierre Carrier']
bug.cf_release_notes: Previously, an attempt to send an LDAP request through an HTTP proxy tunnel ended up with cURL trying to connect to the LDAP server directly using a wrong port number. With this update, the underlying source code has been modified to address this issue, and cURL now works as expected.
bug.summary: proxy tunnel support for LDAP requests is broken

bug.creator: Kamil Dudka
bug.cc: ['Elio Maldonado Batiz', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier', 'Rob Crittenden', 'Bob Relyea']
bug.cf_release_notes: libcurl leaked memory and eventually resulted in a failed NSS shutdown when more than one CA certificate was loaded. This is now fixed so that libcurl works as expected when more than one CA certificates is loaded.
bug.summary: curl --capath memory leakage
[RFE] use reason phrase from HTTP status line in error messages

bug.creator: Upstream Release Monitoring
bug.summary: curl-7.21.4 is available

bug.creator: Alexander Todorov
bug.cc: ['James Antill', 'Jan Pazdziora', 'Kamil Dudka', 'Kai Engert (:kaie)', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier', 'Rob Crittenden', 'Tomas Hoger']
bug.cf_release_notes: When libcurl connected a second time to an SSL server with the same server certificate, the server's certificate was not re-authenticated because libcurl confirmed authenticity before the first connection to the server. This is fixed by disabling the SSL cache when it is not verifying a certificate to force the verification of the certificate on the second use.
bug.summary: suboptimal handling of CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER

bug.creator: Kamil Dudka
bug.cf_release_notes: libcurl leaked memory when an SSL connection failed. This is now fixed to prevent the memory leak during an SSL connection failure.
bug.summary: memory leak on SSL connection failure

bug.creator: He Rui
bug.cc: ['Brock Organ', 'James Laska', 'Jon Masters', 'Jeroen van Meeuwen', 'Kamil Dudka', 'Paul Howarth', 'Tao Wu']
bug.summary: Unable to retrieve ftp repository unless adding a http repo first

bug.creator: Till Maas
bug.summary: curl wrongly parses link-local IPv6 addresses used for proxy

bug.creator: J.H.M. Dassen (Ray)
bug.summary: [RFE] Support SHA2 based certificates

bug.creator: Marcus Sundberg
bug.cc: ['Eduard Benes', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier']
bug.cf_release_notes: Kerberos authentication was broken for reused curl handles, which prevented "git clone"' from working with Kerberos authenticated web servers. This is now fixed to allow "git clone" operations to successfully authenticate and carry out operations.
bug.summary: GSS authentication is broken in libcurl, preventing 'git clone' from working

bug.creator: J.H.M. Dassen (Ray)
bug.cc: [u'Dalibor Posp\xed\u0161il', 'Greg Swift', '', 'David McMath', 'Ondrej Hudlicky', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier', 'Robert Binkhorst', 'Robert Munilla', 'Todd Zullinger']
bug.summary: update running_handles counter properly in curl_multi_remove_handle()

bug.creator: Kamil Dudka
bug.summary: nss needs to be able to use pem files interchangeably in a single process

bug.creator: Denise Dumas
bug.cc: ['Andrius Benokraitis', 'Bryan Kearney', 'Brock Organ', 'Denise Dumas', 'Dennis Gregorovic', 'J.C. Molet', 'Jack Rieden', 'Kamil Dudka', 'Misha H. Ali', 'Mike Khusid', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'John Poelstra', 'Pierre Carrier', 'Suzanne Yeghiayan']
bug.cf_release_notes: It was not possible to use two distinct client certificates to connect two times in a row to the same SSL server. This is now fixed to allow two different client certifications to connect to the same SSL server.
bug.summary: curl AND nss need to be able to use pem files interchangeably in a single process

bug.creator: Phil Knirsch
bug.cc: ['Andrius Benokraitis', 'Bryan Kearney', 'Brock Organ', 'Denise Dumas', 'Dennis Gregorovic', 'James Antill', 'J.C. Molet', 'Jack Rieden', 'Kamil Dudka', 'Mike Khusid', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'John Poelstra', 'Pierre Carrier', 'Suzanne Yeghiayan']
bug.summary: urlgrabber and curl interaction issues with verifyhost and keepalive using certs

bug.creator: Chandrasekar Kannan
bug.summary: CA certificate cannot be specified by nickname [documentation bug]

bug.creator: Upstream Release Monitoring
bug.summary: curl-7.21.6 is available

bug.creator: Robin Bowes
bug.summary: xz-lzma-compat required to build curl but not listed as BuildRequires in spec file

bug.creator: Upstream Release Monitoring
bug.summary: curl-7.21.7 is available

bug.creator: Jan Lieskovsky
bug.summary: CVE-2011-2192 curl: Improper delegation of client credentials during GSS negotiation [fedora-all]

bug.creator: Rob Crittenden
bug.cc: ['Adam Tkac', 'Dmitri Pal', 'Eduard Benes', 'Jenny Galipeau', 'Jakub Hrozek', 'Jeremy West', u'Miloslav Trma\u010d', 'Martin Kosek', u'Marcela Ma\u0161l\xe1\u0148ov\xe1', 'Miroslav Svoboda', 'Miroslav Vadkerti', 'Ondrej Vasik', 'Pierre Carrier', 'J.H.M. Dassen (Ray)']
bug.cf_release_notes: As a solution to a security issue, GSSAPI credential delegation was disabled, which broke the functionality of the applications that were relying on delegation, which was incorrectly enabled by libcurl. To fix this issue, the CURLOPT_GSSAPI_DELEGATION libcurl option has been introduced in order to enable delegation explicitly when applications need it. All applications using GSSAPI credential delegation can now use this new libcurl option to be able to run properly.
bug.summary: Add support for Kerberos ticket delegation

bug.creator: Rob Crittenden
bug.summary: Add support for Kerberos ticket delegation

Dassen (Ray)', 'Tomas Hoger']
bug.cf_release_notes: As a solution to a security issue, GSSAPI credential delegation was disabled, which broke the functionality of the applications that were relying on delegation, which was incorrectly enabled by libcurl. To fix this issue, the CURLOPT_GSSAPI_DELEGATION libcurl option has been introduced in order to enable delegation explicitly when applications need it. All applications using GSSAPI credential delegation can now use this new libcurl option to be able to run properly.
bug.summary: Add support for Kerberos ticket delegation

Dassen (Ray)', 'Bob Relyea', 'Steve Seremeth']
bug.cf_release_notes: The OpenLDAP suite was recently modified to use NSS instead of OpenSSL as the SSL back end. This change led to collisions between libcurl and OpenLDAP on NSS initialization and shutdown. Consequently, applications that were using both, libcurl and OpenLDAP, failed to establish SSL connections. This update modifies libcurl to use the same NSS API as OpenLDAP, which prevents collisions from occurring. Applications using OpenLDAP and libcurl can now connect to the LDAP server over SSL as expected.
bug.summary: OpenLDAP linked with Mozilla NSS intermittently fails to initialize

bug.cf_release_notes: The OpenLDAP suite was recently modified to use NSS instead of OpenSSL as the SSL back end. This change led to collisions between libcurl and OpenLDAP on NSS initialization and shutdown. Consequently, applications that were using both, libcurl and OpenLDAP, failed to establish SSL connections. This update modifies libcurl to use the same NSS API as OpenLDAP, which prevents collisions from occurring. Applications using OpenLDAP and libcurl can now connect to the LDAP server over SSL as expected.

bug.creator: Karel Srot
bug.cf_release_notes:
Cause: libcurl incorrectly checked return values of the SCP/SFTP write functions provided by libssh2.
Consequence: Negative values returned from that functions were treated as negative download amounts, which caused crashes.
Fix: The check of return values was fixed to treat all negative values as errors.
Result: The errors that occur on the SSH level are now properly handle as errors.
bug.summary: curl segfaults when sftp uploading file into fifo file

bug.creator: Artem S. Tashkinov
bug.summary: [PATCH] (lib)curl ignores OPENSSL_CONF environment variable

bug.creator: Karel Srot
bug.cf_release_notes:
Cause: libcurl used the old libssh2 API for uploading files over SCP, which limited the maximum size of files being transferred on 32bit architectures.
Consequence: The 32bit packages of libcurl were not able to transfer large files over SCP.
Fix: The code of libcurl has been changed to use the new libssh2 API for SCP upload, which does not suffer from such a limitation.
Result: libcurl can now upload large files over SCP.
bug.summary: cannot upload large file with curl over scp

bug.creator: Jakub Filak
